{{USFootball team | team = Alabama Outlawz | color1 = lime | color2 = black | logo = Alabama Outlawz logo.jpg | pixels = 200px | founded = 2013 | folded = 2015 | league = [[X-League Indoor Football|XLIF]] (2014–2015) | history = Alabama Outlawz (2014–2015) | arena = [[Bill Harris Arena]] | city = [[Birmingham, Alabama]] | colors = [[Lime (color)|Lime]], [[Black]], [[Silver (color)|Silver]] {{color box|lime}} {{color box|black}} {{color box|silver}} | owner = Lee Ellison | president = | coach = Lee Ellison | championships = '''(0)''' | titles = | cheerleaders = | dancers = | mascot = | website = http://www.bamaoutlawz.com/ }} The '''Alabama Outlawz''' were a professional [[Indoor American football|indoor football]] team that played in [[X-League Indoor Football]]. Based in [[Birmingham, Alabama]], the Outlawz played their home games at [[Bill Harris Arena]]. ==Franchise history== It was announced in November 2013, that the Outlawz would be joining X-League Indoor Football for its inaugural [[2014 X-League Indoor Football season|2014 season]], playing their home games in Bill Harris Arena at the Birmingham CrossPlex. Lee Ellison, who was 37 years old when the Outlawz were founded in 2013, has remained the owner of the franchise.{{cite web | url=http://www.al.com/sports/index.ssf/2013/11/new_spring_arena_football_team.html | title=New spring indoor football team launching in Birmingham in March 2014 | publisher=al.com | date=November 11, 2013 | accessdate=December 27, 2014 | author=Crenshawv Jr., Solomon}} ===2014 season=== The Outlawz finished the season with a record of 5–3–1. The Outlawz had the number one offense under Offensive Coordinator Mike Bonner.{{cite web|url=http://www.birminghamprosports.com/alabamaoutlawzgames.htm |title=2014 Alabama Outlawz |publisher=birminghamprosports.com |accessdate=December 27, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141227224945/http://www.birminghamprosports.com/alabamaoutlawzgames.htm |archivedate=December 27, 2014 }} They won the first game ever played in the X-League.{{cite web|url=http://www.birminghamprosports.com/alabamaoutlawzmain.htm |title=Team Overview |publisher=birminghamprosports.com |accessdate=December 27, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141227213217/http://www.birminghamprosports.com/alabamaoutlawzmain.htm |archivedate=December 27, 2014 }} The one tie came as a result of the final game being declared a 7–7 tie as the Outlawz and their opponents, the [[Georgia Rampage]], were both out of X-Bowl contention. The league deemed it financially responsible to consider the game a tie and use the operation cost to prepare for the [[2015 X-League Indoor Football season|2015 season]].{{cite web|url=http://www.birminghamprosports.com/alabamaoutlawzhistory.htm |title=Team and League History |publisher=birminghamprosports.com |accessdate=December 27, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141227224712/http://www.birminghamprosports.com/alabamaoutlawzhistory.htm |archivedate=December 27, 2014 }} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 92%;" "align=center" |- ! rowspan="2" | Date !! rowspan="2" | Kickoff !! rowspan="2" | Opponent !! colspan="2" | Results !! rowspan="2" | Game site |- ! Final score !!
